results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Johnno is 10 years of age, deaf and always in strife. He lives in a small fishing town and he has an affinity with the sea that he shares with Tony, an Italian fisherman, whom the townsfolk also ridicule. Johnno’s best friend is his sister, Julie, who is going away to boarding school in the city. When Johnno discovers this news he is devastated and runs away to his secret place - a deserted island. Johnno’s running away causes much havoc in the small community and the experience helps him realise that he must learn to live with his deafness and trust those who love him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Top enders (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Nick, an Aboriginal boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot, only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival, Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and their families from which they have fled.

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel west to discover the mystery and magic of their land. However the children discover a darker side to their new found fortune.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate (K)
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned tospy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Cast includes Justine Clark, Lyndel Rowe, Alan Cassel, Myra Noblet, Shane Tickner, Rebeh Elmalog Lou, Lorna Lesley, Martin Sacks, Mouche Phillips, Claudia Karvan, Beth Buchanan. Written by Kristin and David Williamson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Ogilvie, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
